block.p: American League CHICAGO WHITE SOX--Purchased the contract of RHP Ken Hill from Charlotte of the International League. Optioned RHP Kevin Beirne to Charlotte. CLEVELAND INDIANS--Recalled INF John McDonald from Buffalo of the International League. Optioned INF-OF Chan Perry to Buffalo. Signed INF Sean Berry to a minor league contract and assigned him to Buffalo of the International League. DETROIT TIGERS--Signed C Brad Wise to a minor league contract. TEXAS RANGERS--Sent RHP Ryan Glynn to Oklahoma of the PCL on a rehabilitation assignment.

American League CHICAGO WHITE SOX--Purchased the contract of RHP Ken Hill from Charlotte of the International League. Optioned RHP Kevin Beirne to Charlotte. CLEVELAND INDIANS--Recalled INF John McDonald from Buffalo of the International League. Optioned INF-OF Chan Perry to Buffalo. Signed INF Sean Berry to a minor league contract and assigned him to Buffalo of the International League. DETROIT TIGERS--Signed C Brad Wise to a minor league contract. TEXAS RANGERS--Sent RHP Ryan Glynn to Oklahoma of the PCL on a rehabilitation assignment.

National League LOS ANGELES DODGERS--Placed OF F.P. Santangelo on the 15-day disabled list. Purchased the contract of INF Jeff Branson from Albuquerque of the PCL. Designated RHP Apostol Garcia for assignment.
National Basketball Association LOS ANGELES CLIPPERS--Named John Hammond, Dennis Johnson and Rex Kalamian assistant coaches.

National Football League NFL--Reduced the suspension of New York Jets OT Jumbo Elliott from two games to one for his part in a bar fight in July 1999. ARIZONA CARDINALS--Released RB Mario Bates, WR Andy McCullough, TE Derek Brown, DT Mike Moten and DT Angel Rubio. GIANTS--Announced the resignation of Jim Skipper assistant head coach to become coach of Memphis of the XFL. Promoted quality control coach Mike Gillhammer to running backs coach.

United States Olympic Committee USOC--Announced the resignation of Darryl Seibel, associate director of media and public relations, to become director of operations and strategic planning for the Colorado Springs Sports Corporation.

ALBANY, N.Y.--Named Kevin Galuski equipment manager, Kevin Van Derzee assistant football coach, and Adam Clinton and Bernie Watt men's assistant soccer coaches. BRADLEY--Named Matt Barber men's interim assistant soccer coach. CALDWELL--Named Steve O'Neal men's assistant soccer coach. CAZENOVIA--Named Todd Widrick men's basketball coach, men's soccer coach and sports information director. DELAWARE VALLEY--Named Junior Hyman running backs coach, Jason Langdon offensive line coach, Justin McEwen defensive line coach, Damon Perry quarterbacks-receivers coach, David Russell defensive coordinator-line coach, Joe Sincovich linebackers coach and Thomas Siver secondary coach. DOMINICAN, N.Y.--Named Laura Cannon assistant athletic director, Michael Swanwick men's soccer coach, Patrick Parenti men's assistant soccer coach, and John McNamara assistant baseball coach. EMPORIA STATE--Named Joseph Biggs assistant athletic director for development and external affairs. FELICIAN--Named John Murray and Matt Ramagli pitching coaches, Steve Villareale outfield coach, and Frank DiLiberto catching and infield coach. FLORIDA INTERNATIONAL--Named Lonnie Williams men's assistant basketball coach. GREENSBORO--Named David Horne assistant golf coach. GUILFORD--Named John Browning, Idris Coleman, Aaron Denton, Jason Gottlieb and David Heggie assistant football coaches. HARTWICK--Named Trent Patterson offensive line coach, Kirk Aikens wide receivers coach, and Jason Hilton defensive line coach. KENT STATE--Named Michael Heichel interim assistant athletic trainer. LEMOYNE--Named Chip Warner men's assistant soccer coach. URSINUS--Named Terry McGowan softball coach.
